This ancillary study conduct among sub-cohort 773 participant VITAL test efficacy safety high-dose vitamin D supplementation vs. placebo skeletal health body composition .
DOC.brief_title: VITamin D OmegA-3 TriaL : Effects Bone Structure Architecture
DOC.detailed_description: The VITAL : Effects Bone Structure Architecture ancillary study parent VITAL . This study enrol sub-cohort 773 VITAL participant NIH-sponsored Harvard Catalyst Clinical Translational Science Center ( CTSC ) . The following measurement perform baseline 2 year post-randomization determine whether high-dose vitamin D supplementation vs. placebo : 1 ) produce small increase reduce bone loss spine , hip , total body areal bone density assess dual x-ray absorptiometry ( DXA ) ; 2 ) reduces bone turnover assess biomarkers bone resorption formation ; 3 ) improves ( ) volumetric bone mineral density ( vBMD ) measure bone structure assess peripheral quantitative compute tomography ( pQCT ) ( b ) bone microarchitecture assess high resolution pQCT ( HR-pQCT ) distal radius tibia ; 4 ) result change body composition assess DXA . Parallel assessments effect omega-3 fatty acid perform . This study may elucidate mechanism high-dose vitamin D may prevent age-related fracture provide new insight role vitamin D skeletal health body composition .
